description:
Get a paginated list of public models.

Example cURL request:

```console
curl -s \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $REPLICATE_API_TOKEN" \
  https://api.replicate.com/v1/models
```

The response will be a pagination object containing a list of model objects.

See the [`models.get`](#models.get) docs for more details about the model object.

## Sorting

You can sort the results using the `sort_by` and `sort_direction` query parameters.

For example, to get the most recently created models:

```console
curl -s \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $REPLICATE_API_TOKEN" \
  "https://api.replicate.com/v1/models?sort_by=model_created_at&sort_direction=desc"
```

Available sorting options:
- `model_created_at`: Sort by when the model was first created
- `latest_version_created_at`: Sort by when the model's latest version was created (default)

Sort direction can be `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending, default).

parameters.description: Field to sort models by. Defaults to `latest_version_created_at`.
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Sort direction. Defaults to `desc` (descending, newest first).
parameters.name: sort_direction

next.description: A URL pointing to the next page of model objects, if any

previous.description: A URL pointing to the previous page of model objects, if any

cover_image_url.description: A URL for the model's cover image

github_url.description: A URL for the model's source code on GitHub

is_official.description: Boolean indicating whether the model is officially maintained by Replicate. Official models are always on, have stable API interfaces, and predictable pricing.

license_url.description: A URL for the model's license

owner.description: The name of the user or organization that owns the model

paper_url.description: A URL for the model's paper

run_count.description: The number of times the model has been run

url.description: The URL of the model on Replicate

visibility.description: Whether the model is public or private
